title: When Congenital Heart Repair Is Good but Vision Is Not –a Rare Occurrence of Cortical Visual Impairment Due to Unilateral Subdural Hematoma
content: Blindness or visual impairment following congenital heart repair is a rare complication. It can be transient or permanent depending in underlying etiology and damage to optic pathway. We report first case of transient blindness following congenital heart repair due to unilateral subdural hematoma in occipital region.
